block.p: Christina Connie Donato, a daughter of Eugenia and Louis Donato of Medford, N.J., was married yesterday to John Rudofker Saler, a son of Odelle Winthrop of Hallandale, Fla., and the late Morton Saler. Alan K. Silberstein, the president judge emeritus of the Philadelphia Municipal Court, officiated at the Union League club in Philadelphia. Rabbi Claire M. Green and the Rev. Joseph McOscar, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.

The bride, 27, is a senior account executive with Tierney Communications, an advertising agency in Philadelphia. She graduated from Fairfield University. Her father is a marketing consultant in Medford. Her mother is an administrator in the diagnostic center at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.

Her father is a marketing consultant in Medford. Her mother is an administrator in the diagnostic center at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.

The bridegroom, 41, is a registered corporate lobbyist with William W. Batoff Associates, a lobbying firm in Philadelphia. He is also the president of Lake Como Pictures, a film and television production company in Beverly Hills, Calif. He graduated from George Washington University. His father retired as a partner in Renaire Foods, a meat supplier that was in Thorofare, N.J. The bridegroom is a grandson of Matthew B. Rudofker, the founder of After Six, a manufacturer of men's formalwear in Philadelphia.
